page.title: 20Farming in Chobham
page.content: Mr Savage's policy has been forced on him because of the{poor land.}Some fields are water meadows with a peat soil but most of the land is{acid soil on top of sand and gravel. The soil is treated with{lime}every three years.He produces{grazing land}for cattle and grass for{hay.}Fourty five{bulls}are kept in one field.The best age to buy cattle is{two years.}Mr Savage buys in the autumn, keeps them through the winter and sells them in early spring. The amount of hay produced governs how many bulls are bought. Because of the well drained soil buildings are not expensive. The{buildings}are lean-to's which are corrigated iron roofs on top of chestnut posts.This construction allows air to circulate round the {machinery}keeping it dry. He also has a barn for{hay.}The animals are kept as near to nature as possible.
